newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian insurance supervisor to tighten controls.
newsitem.headline: Russian insurance supervisor to tighten controls.

text.p: The finance ministry's insurance supervision department will monitor Russia's insurance firms more strictly, the head of the newly created department said on Tuesday.

"Control of the insurance market will be strengthened," Valery Sukhov told a news conference. "The finance ministry has a wide network of subsidiaries. Control will become more robust, Sukhov used to be deputy head of the Federal Insurance Supervision Service (Rosstrakhnadzor), which was incorporated into the Finance Ministry under an August presidential decree.

"We assume the transfer of supervision rights to the finance ministry may have a positive effect, as the finance ministry has a higher place in the federal government than the former Rosstrakhnadzor," Sukhov said.
He said he would push for approval of a new insurance bill raising companies' authorised capital and requiring them to present more data about their activities to the government.
Most insurance companies do not have enough assets and capital, he said.
